property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Freedom Fighter

property.name: Rules
property.value: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Freedom Fighter

property.name: Rules
property.value: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."

property.name: Rules
property.value: +3 [Memory Units] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caissa programs. Whenever you install a Caissa program, you may trigger its [Click] ability without spending [Click]. Limit 1 console per player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 2 [Credits]: Break subroutine on host ice. [Click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caissa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 2 [Credits]: Break subroutine on host ice.||[Click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caissa.

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X [Credits] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may reveal all cards in HQ.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When your turn ends, gain 1 [Credits] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1 [Credits]: +1 strength.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.||1 [Credits]: +1 strength

property.name: Rules
property.value: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Looks can be deceiving.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever the Corp takes a least 1 bad publicity, access 1 card from HQ. [Trash]: Expose 1 card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." - Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective "One of the best detectives on my PI list." - Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate-Bioroid

property.name: Rules
property.value: The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0. [Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run. [Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I'm getting a reading that is...off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen subtype cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.

property.name: Rules
property.value: The first time the Runner spends at least 1 [Click] on his or her turn, gain 2 [Credits] unless the Runner just initiated a run on this server.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1 [Credits].

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip||Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip and trash 1 of those cards.||[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ireress gains "[Subroutine] The Runner loses 1 [Credits]." for each bad publicity you have.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Say it really fast.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Weyland Consortium

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Gray Ops

property.name: Rules
property.value: Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn. Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Weyland Consortium

property.name: Rules
property.value: If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It folds under pressure.

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click]. Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."

property.name: Instructions
property.value: onPlay[Install a card from Archives|-|Install a card from HQ]
